answers.answer: Do you have a family history of Diabetes? Or Have you had a Physical lately? Either way , go see y pop III r Dr. She/He may want to have some labs done. Be sure to ask to have your blood glucose tested. Tell your doc of any sleep problems, dry mouth, weight loss or gain. Lifestyle changes? I hope an answer can be found.

question: I keep having to pee more frequently than usual and even after I go I still feel like I have to. it's mostly just the pressure. I can't be pregnant, I haven't done anything remotely sexual since July. I had an abortion in late June, however if it wasn't successful I'm sure I would've noticed by now. I went to the walk in and had my urine tested, no signs of infection. What could be up?
title: Frequent urination at night, no pain or burning
